lines.text: But, murder is the occupation of Generals.
Then let us say what is admirable on the large scale is monstrous on the small. Since we must give medals to mass murderers, why not give justice to the small... entrepreneur.
Welcome, Colonel Grau, to the spider's web.
How did you know it was me?
What other German Colonel would enter unannounced?
Any SS Colonel would.

[to Morand]
I've always felt that even in war, gentlemen, though they may be on opposing sides, still have much in common. It was everyone's misfortune that Hitler was not a gentleman.
It's like the natural functions. Revolting, but inevitable.
Patience is one the few virtues that I possess.
But what happens if the murderer really is a general?
What happens? Well, justice is blind, my dear Inspector. Justice cannot see the red stripe or the gold braid, but justice can sometimes hear the cry of a murdered woman.
That maniac is blowing up half the city!
I have a zealous nature, Sir, I can't help it.
I am a traitor - a traitor to a madman.

[outside Maxim's]
An adequate restaurant, very clean.

[to Hartmann]
I don't want to have to blow your handsome head to pieces.
Her name was Kupiecka. Maria Kupiecka.
Kupiecka? Oh, yes, she was a prostitute. And a good friend to us!
She was also a German agent.
Killed by a Polish patriot?
Providing the Polish patriot was also a sexual degenerate.
Patriotism has been known to have its vicious side.
